title: DataFrame.ix losing row ordering when index has duplicates
raw_output:
{'files_to_modify': ['pandas/core/indexing.py', 'pandas/core/frame.py', 'pandas/core/index.py', 'pandas/core/common.py', 'pandas/core/algorithms.py'], 'reasoning': '1. pandas/core/indexing.py: Most likely to contain the .ix indexer or its dispatch logic, responsible for interpreting row selection input and passing control to the right mechanism.
2. pandas/core/frame.py: Contains the DataFrame class; selection, indexing, and construction of result DataFrames occurs here, so output row reordering logic is required.
3. pandas/core/index.py: Implements the Index class and lookup logic; label matching and enforcement of input ordering likely occurs here, especially for indices with duplicates.
4. pandas/core/common.py: Houses shared utility functions for index and selection handling that may be called by indexers and DataFrame selection code.
5. pandas/core/algorithms.py: Often contains high-performance utilities for row location and ordering, potentially used to implement the desired ordering.'}
